markdown: <::A black and white illustration depicts a hand holding the handle of a tool, possibly a woodworking plane. The hand is on the left side, gripping a curved handle. The tool extends to the right, with a blade or cutting mechanism visible near the front. The background is dark on the left, contrasting with the lighter tool body.: figure::> By Pat Morrison All shows are free at MAUI MALL on Fridays at 7 p.m. and Saturdays at 1 p.m.; bring a camera, its a must. Maui Mall is in Kahului. O'ROURKE'S CARD & GIFT SHOP is the most complete card store in Hawaii. O'Rourke's carries all types of souven- irs; greetings cards, gift wraps, station- ery, and knick-knacks. SIR WILFRED'S the world's finest cof- fees including Hawaii's own Kona Coffee. Samples of fresh ground coffee are yours while shopping for accessories or tobac- co items. Look for the life-size Wooden Cowboy. The workmanship is excellent at LUANA ORIGINALS (next to the La- haina Broiler at 869 Front Street). This store features alluring sarongs and biki- nis, made to order in the material of your choice. EMERALDS INTERNATIONAL at 858-1 Front Street in Lahaina, excels in offering the finest emeralds from South America. Owner Manuel Marcial makes frequent trips to his native Colombia to bring back exquisite gems which he cuts and designs into original jewelry pieces. Internationally known for his sculp- tures, Malcolm Moran's works are exhi- amely at GALLERY CARMEL, which is located at 713 Front Street in Lahaina and is owned by Deanna and Harry Hai- moff. Harry is equally popular for his original jewelry designs THE PINK & BLACK CORAL FACTORY transforms coral from Pacific Ocean reefs into glorious jewelry for you! Take a factory tour and see the local craftspeople at work. Located just a few minutes from the airport at 38 Airport Road, Kahului and open Monday thru Saturday from 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. The SOUTH SEAS TRADING POST at 851 Front Street in Lahaina is owned by the popular Joan and "Mac" McKelvey and they take frequent trips to the South Pacific and far Asian islands in their continuous search for rare and exotic jewelry, basketwear and artifacts. Other stores are in Kona and Kauai. Other stores are in Kona and Kauai. Lahaina's POI FACTORY, conveni- ently located at 819 Front Street, special- izes in bikinis and dresses. The fun fa- shions are one of a kind — each is hand- made by one of a variety of island de- signers and all of the creations are rea- sonably priced. Visit HOUSE OF JEWELS (in Kaanapali's Maui Surf Hotel) and see the quality jewelry chosen from the world's gem marts. The owners Florence and Phil Ward have the Registered Jeweler title which is awarded by the highly esteemed American Gem Society. They also have a priceless selection of Japanese sword ornaments (netsukes). Another store is in the Kauai Surf Hotel. JOHN OF MAUI, a wood carver who's hard to beat, offers factory tours Monday through Saturday from 9 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. To find beautifully fash- ioned statues of Hawaii's deep sea fish, uniquely carved bowles and hand-carved wooden plaqes, go to 599 Haleakala Highway (near the airport). LAHAINA SQUARE is a shoppers oasis. Plenty of convenient parking, with a grand variety of stores and amenites. In Lahaina makai of the sugar stack. CASSIDY & ME features sporting, el- egant casual attire. Located in Lahaina Square this apparel shop caters to beach- (Continued on page 37) The dancers of the Pacific. The drums of the Islands. The feast and fun of Luau Pacifica. The flowers of Kauai. <::Illustration of a woman's profile with flowers in her hair, set against a circular background depicting a mountain and a sun/moon. : figure::> Kauai's Paradise Pacifica is a tropical garden filled with history, legend and song. Our blossoms open daily at 10 a.m., the Luau Pacifica comes on at 5 p.m., followed at 7:15 p.m. by the most exciting dance pageantry in the islands. KAUAI'S PARADISE PACIFICA 822-4911—WAILUA RIVER MARINA STATE PARK Music of Hawaii · South Pacific ## CATALOG Listings of available records, tapes, sheet music, etc. Showing artists, content, prices, and charges. <::An illustration of six album covers arranged in a circle around a central dot. The album covers are: - Top center: A close-up of a person's face. - Top left: "FAVORITES INSTRUMENTALS OF THE ISLANDS" with a stylized 'NB' and other design elements. - Top right: "Babypoom" with four faces. - Bottom left: "Tihati's BORA BORATE" with a group of people. - Bottom center: "Kabe" with a row of four faces. - Bottom right: "QUEEN LIKES HAWAIIAN COUNTRY" with a person wearing a hat. Below the album covers, there is a logo that reads "HOUSE OF Music". : figure::> Send $5.75 (includes handling) to: House of Music Ltd. 1365 Colburn St. we mail world wide <::logo: Fair Way Rent-A-Car System of Hawaii FAIR WAY RENT-A-CAR SYSTEM OF HAWAII The logo features the word "FAIR WAY" in a stylized, outlined font within a rounded rectangular shape, next to the text "RENT-A-CAR SYSTEM OF HAWAII" in a bold, sans-serif font.::> 1978 NEW MODELS, G.M., FORD & others <::logo: Unknown FROM $9.95 PER DAY The design features bold black text for the price '$9.95', with 'FROM' and 'PER DAY' in smaller, less prominent black text.::> ALSO SPECIAL WEEKLY, MONTHLY RATES AND FREE MILEAGE FREE AIRPORT PICK-UP Use Courtesy phone at Baggage Area MAUI 877-5594 KAHULUI AIRPORT FREE HOTEL - CONDO PICK-UP KAHULUI & KEIHI OAHU 922-2733 HONOLULU AIRPORT FREE AIRPORT & WAIKIKI PICK-UP MOST MAJOR CREDIT CARDS EXCEPTED Latitude 20/November 1978 27

chunks.markdown: <::A black and white illustration depicts a hand holding the handle of a tool, possibly a woodworking plane. The hand is on the left side, gripping a curved handle. The tool extends to the right, with a blade or cutting mechanism visible near the front. The background is dark on the left, contrasting with the lighter tool body.: figure::>
By Pat Morrison

All shows are free at MAUI MALL on Fridays at 7 p.m. and Saturdays at 1 p.m.; bring a camera, its a must. Maui Mall is in Kahului. O'ROURKE'S CARD & GIFT SHOP is the most complete card store in Hawaii. O'Rourke's carries all types of souven- irs; greetings cards, gift wraps, station- ery, and knick-knacks. SIR WILFRED'S the world's finest cof- fees including Hawaii's own Kona Coffee. Samples of fresh ground coffee are yours while shopping for accessories or tobac- co items. Look for the life-size Wooden Cowboy.
The workmanship is excellent at LUANA ORIGINALS (next to the La- haina Broiler at 869 Front Street). This store features alluring sarongs and biki- nis, made to order in the material of your choice.

EMERALDS INTERNATIONAL at 858-1 Front Street in Lahaina, excels in offering the finest emeralds from South America. Owner Manuel Marcial makes frequent trips to his native Colombia to bring back exquisite gems which he cuts and designs into original jewelry pieces.

Internationally known for his sculp- tures, Malcolm Moran's works are exhi- amely at GALLERY CARMEL, which is located at 713 Front Street in Lahaina and is owned by Deanna and Harry Hai- moff. Harry is equally popular for his original jewelry designs

THE PINK & BLACK CORAL FACTORY transforms coral from Pacific Ocean reefs into glorious jewelry for you! Take a factory tour and see the local craftspeople at work. Located just a few minutes from the airport at 38 Airport Road, Kahului and open Monday thru Saturday from 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. The SOUTH SEAS TRADING POST at 851 Front Street in Lahaina is owned by the popular Joan and "Mac" McKelvey and they take frequent trips to the South Pacific and far Asian islands in their continuous search for rare and exotic jewelry, basketwear and artifacts. Other stores are in Kona and Kauai.

Other stores are in Kona and Kauai. Lahaina's POI FACTORY, conveni- ently located at 819 Front Street, special- izes in bikinis and dresses. The fun fa- shions are one of a kind — each is hand- made by one of a variety of island de-
signers and all of the creations are rea- sonably priced.

Visit HOUSE OF JEWELS (in Kaanapali's Maui Surf Hotel) and see the quality jewelry chosen from the world's gem marts. The owners Florence and Phil Ward have the Registered Jeweler title which is awarded by the highly esteemed American Gem Society. They also have a priceless selection of Japanese sword ornaments (netsukes). Another store is in the Kauai Surf Hotel.

JOHN OF MAUI, a wood carver who's hard to beat, offers factory tours Monday through Saturday from 9 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. To find beautifully fash- ioned statues of Hawaii's deep sea fish, uniquely carved bowles and hand-carved wooden plaqes, go to 599 Haleakala Highway (near the airport).
LAHAINA SQUARE is a shoppers oasis. Plenty of convenient parking, with a grand variety of stores and amenites. In Lahaina makai of the sugar stack.
CASSIDY & ME features sporting, el- egant casual attire. Located in Lahaina Square this apparel shop caters to beach- (Continued on page 37)

The dancers of the Pacific. The drums of the Islands. The feast and fun of Luau Pacifica. The flowers of Kauai. <::Illustration of a woman's profile with flowers in her hair, set against a circular background depicting a mountain and a sun/moon. : figure::> Kauai's Paradise Pacifica is a tropical garden filled with history, legend and song. Our blossoms open daily at 10 a.m., the Luau Pacifica comes on at 5 p.m., followed at 7:15 p.m. by the most exciting dance pageantry in the islands. KAUAI'S PARADISE PACIFICA 822-4911—WAILUA RIVER MARINA STATE PARK
Music of Hawaii · South Pacific
## CATALOG Listings of available records, tapes, sheet music, etc. Showing artists, content, prices, and charges.

<::An illustration of six album covers arranged in a circle around a central dot. The album covers are: - Top center: A close-up of a person's face. - Top left: "FAVORITES INSTRUMENTALS OF THE ISLANDS" with a stylized 'NB' and other design elements. - Top right: "Babypoom" with four faces. - Bottom left: "Tihati's BORA BORATE" with a group of people. - Bottom center: "Kabe" with a row of four faces. - Bottom right: "QUEEN LIKES HAWAIIAN COUNTRY" with a person wearing a hat. Below the album covers, there is a logo that reads "HOUSE OF Music". : figure::> Send $5.75 (includes handling) to: House of Music Ltd. 1365 Colburn St.
we mail world wide
